file.intro:
The FIX 4.2 specification delivered enhancements over FIX 4.1 in the following areas:Enhancements to better support exchanges and ECNs (Market Data, Security Definition and Status etc.)Program/Basket Trading support'Mass quoting' support for equity optionsSupport for Japanese requirements (Japanese character sets, order handling, and allocation support)Enhanced foreign exchange capabilityFixed Income IOI capability for High Yield and High Grade corporate bondsOrder pre-allocation functionality.
Other enhancements and clarificationsThe data presented here includes the 20010501 Errata which corrected a number of typographical errors or ambiguities in the original specification, and which introduced a number of new fields to address various omissions.

types.name: Amt
types.desc: float field typically representing a Price times a Qty

types.name: Boolean
types.desc: char field containing one of two values:Y = True/YesN = False/No

types.name: char
types.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

types.name: Country
types.desc: string field representing a country using ISO 3166 Country code (2 character) values (see Appendix 6-B).

types.name: Currency
types.desc: string field representing a currency type using ISO 4217 Currency code (3 character) values (see Appendix 6-A).

types.name: data
types.desc: string field containing raw data with no format or content restrictions. Data fields are always immediately preceded by a length field. The length field should specify the number of bytes of the value of the data field (up to but not including the terminating SOH).Caution=> the value of one of these fields may contain the delimiter (SOH) character. Note that the value specified for this field should be followed by the delimiter (SOH) character as all fields are terminated with an 'SOH'.

types.name: DayOfMonth
types.desc: int field representing a day during a particular monthy (values 1 to 31).

types.name: Exchange
types.desc: string field representing a market or exchange using ISO 10383 Market Identifier Code (MIC) values

types.name: float
types.desc: Sequence of digits with optional decimal point and sign character (ASCII characters '-', '0' - '9' and '.'); the absence of the decimal point within the string will be interpreted as the float representation of an integer value. All float fields must accommodate up to fifteen significant digits. The number of decimal places used should be a factor of business/market needs and mutual agreement between counterparties. Note that float values may contain leading zeros (e.g. '00023.23' = '23.23') and may contain or omit trailing zeros after the decimal point (e.g. '23.0' = '23.0000' = '23' = '23.').Note that fields which are derived from float may contain negative values unless explicitly specified otherwise. The following data types are based on float.

types.name: int
types.desc: Sequence of digits without commas or decimals and optional sign character (ASCII characters '-' and '0' - '9' ). The sign character utilizes one byte (i.e. positive int is '99999' while negative int is '-99999'). Note that int values may contain leading zeros (e.g. '00023' = '23').Examples =>723 in field 21 would be mapped int as |21=723|.-723 in field 12 would be mapped int as |12=-723|

types.name: Length
types.desc: int field representing the length in bytes. Value must be positive.

types.name: LocalMktDate
types.desc: string field represening a Date of Local Market (as oppose to UTC) in YYYYMMDD format. This is the 'normal' date field used by the FIX Protocol.Valid values:YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31.

types.name: MonthYear
types.desc: string field representing month of a year. An optional day of the month can be appended or an optional week code.Valid formats:YYYYMMYYYYMMDDYYYYMMWWValid values:YYYY = 0000-9999; MM = 01-12; DD = 01-31; WW = w1, w2, w3, w4, w5.

types.name: MultipleStringValue
types.desc: string field containing one or more space delimited multiple character values (e.g. |277=AV AN A| ).

types.name: NumInGroup
types.desc: int field representing the number of entries in a repeating group. Value must be positive.

types.name: Percentage
types.desc: float field representing a percentage (e.g. 0.05 represents 5% and 0.9525 represents 95.25%). Note the number of decimal places may vary.

types.name: Price
types.desc: float field representing a price. Note the number of decimal places may vary. For certain asset classes prices may be negative values. For example, prices for options strategies can be negative under certain market conditions. Refer to Volume 7=> FIX Usage by Product for asset classes that support negative price values.

types.name: PriceOffset
types.desc: float field representing a price offset, which can be mathematically added to a 'Price'. Note the number of decimal places may vary and some fields such as LastForwardPoints may be negative.

types.name: Qty
types.desc: float field capable of storing either a whole number (no decimal places) of 'shares' (securities denominated in whole units) or a decimal value containing decimal places for non-share quantity asset classes (securities denominated in fractional units).

types.name: String
types.desc: Alpha-numeric free format strings, can include any character or punctuation except the delimiter. All String fields are case sensitive (i.e. morstatt != Morstatt).

types.name: UTCDateOnly
types.desc: string field representing Date represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in YYYYMMDD format. This special-purpose field is paired with UTCTimeOnly to form a proper UTCTimestamp for bandwidth-sensitive messages.Valid values:YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31.

types.name: UTCTimeOnly
types.desc: string field representing Time-only represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in either HH=>MM=>SS (whole seconds) or HH=>MM=>SS.sss (milliseconds) format, colons, and period required. This special-purpose field is paired with UTCDateOnly to form a proper UTCTimestamp for bandwidth-sensitive messages.Valid values:HH = 00-23, MM = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second), SS = 00-59. (without milliseconds)HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second), sss=000-999 (indicating milliseconds).

types.name: UTCTimestamp
types.desc: string field representing Time/date combination represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in either YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS (whole seconds) or YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS.sss (milliseconds) format, colons, dash, and period required.Valid values:YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second) (without milliseconds).YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second), sss=000-999 (indicating milliseconds).Leap Seconds=> Note that UTC includes corrections for leap seconds, which are inserted to account for slowing of the rotation of the earth. Leap second insertion is declared by the International Earth Rotation Service (IERS) and has, since 1972, only occurred on the night of Dec. 31 or Jun 30. The IERS considers March 31 and September 30 as secondary dates for leap second insertion, but has never utilized these dates. During a leap second insertion, a UTCTimestamp field may read '19981231-23:59:59', '19981231-23:59:60', '19990101-00:00:00'

messages.name: Heartbeat
messages.intro: The Heartbeat monitors the status of the communication link and identifies when the last of a string of messages was not received.

fields.name: TestReqID
fields.desc: Required when the heartbeat is the result of a Test Request message. Identifier included in Test Request message to be returned in resulting Heartbeat

messages.name: Test Request
messages.intro: The test request message forces a heartbeat from the opposing application.

fields.name: TestReqID
fields.desc: Identifier included in Test Request message to be returned in resulting Heartbeat

messages.name: Resend Request
messages.intro: The resend request is sent by the receiving application to initiate the retransmission of messages. This function is utilized if a sequence number gap is detected, if the receiving application lost a message, or as a function of the initialization process.

fields.name: BeginSeqNo
fields.desc: Message sequence number of first message in range to be resent

fields.name: EndSeqNo
fields.desc: Message sequence number of last message in range to be resent. If request is for a single message BeginSeqNo = EndSeqNo. If request is for all messages subsequent to a particular message, EndSeqNo = "0" (representing infinity).

messages.name: Reject
messages.intro: The reject message should be issued when a message is received but cannot be properly processed due to a session-level rule violation.

fields.name: RefSeqNum
fields.desc: MsgSeqNum of rejected message Reference message sequence number

fields.name: RefTagID
fields.desc: The tag number of the FIX field being referenced. The tag number of the FIX field being referenced.

fields.name: RefMsgType
fields.desc: The MsgType of the FIX message being referenced. The MsgType of the FIX message being referenced.

fields.name: SessionRejectReason
fields.desc: Code to identify reason for a session-level Reject message. Code to identify reason for a session-level Reject message.

values.desc: Tag not defined for this message type
Value is incorrect (out of range) for this tag

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Where possible, message to explain reason for rejection Free format text string. Note: this field does not have a specified maximum length

fields.name: EncodedTextLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedText field.

fields.name: EncodedText
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the Text field.

messages.name: Sequence Reset
messages.intro: The sequence reset message is used by the sending application to reset the incoming sequence number on the opposing side.

fields.name: GapFillFlag
fields.desc: Indicates that the Sequence Reset message is replacing administrative or application messages which will not be resent.

values.desc: Gap Fill message, MsgSeqNum field valid

fields.name: NewSeqNo
fields.desc: New sequence number

messages.name: Logout
messages.intro: The logout message initiates or confirms the termination of a FIX session.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string. Note: this field does not have a specified maximum length

fields.name: EncodedTextLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedText field.

fields.name: EncodedText
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the Text field.

messages.name: IOI
messages.intro: Indication of interest messages market merchandise which the broker is buying or selling in either a proprietary or agency capacity.

fields.name: IOIid
fields.desc: Unique identifier of IOI message.

fields.name: IOITransType
fields.desc: Identifies IOI message transaction type

fields.name: IOIRefID
fields.desc: Required for Cancel and Replace IOITransType messages Reference identifier used with CANCEL and REPLACE, transaction types.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Note also see SecurityType. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID

values.desc: Consolidated Tape Association (CTA) Symbol (SIAC CTS/CQS line format)

fields.name: SecurityType
fields.desc: Must be specified if a Future or Option. If a Future: Symbol, SecurityType, and MaturityMonthYear are required. If an Option: Symbol, SecurityType, MaturityMonthYear, PutOrCall, and StrikePrice are required. Indicates type of security (ISITC spec)

values.desc: Wildcard entry (used on Security Definition Request message)
Convertible Bond (Note not part of ISITC spec)
Cats, Tigers & Lions (a real code: US Treasury Receipts)

fields.name: MaturityMonthYear
fields.desc: Specifiesthe month and year of maturity. Required if MaturityDay is specified. Month and Year of the maturity for SecurityType=FUT or SecurityType=OPT. Required if MaturityDay is specified. Format: YYYYMM (eg. 199903)

fields.name: MaturityDay
fields.desc: Can be used in conjunction with MaturityMonthYear to specify a particular maturity date. Day of month used in conjunction with MaturityMonthYear to specify the maturity date for SecurityType=FUT or SecurityType=OPT.

fields.name: PutOrCall
fields.desc: For Options. Indicates whether an Option is for a put or call.

fields.name: StrikePrice
fields.desc: For Options. Strike Price for an Option.

fields.name: OptAttribute
fields.desc: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants to indicate a versioning of the contract when required due to corporate actions to the underlying. Should not be used to indicate type of option - use the CFICode[461] for this purpose. Can be used for SecurityType (67) =OPT to identify a particular security. Valid values vary by SecurityExchange:For Exchange: MONEP (Paris)L = Long (a.k.a. "American")S = Short (a.k.a. "European")For Exchanges: DTB (Frankfurt), HKSE (Hong Kong), and SOFFEX (Zurich)0-9 = single digit "version" number assigned by exchange following capital adjustments (0=current, =prior, 2=prior to , etc).

fields.name: ContractMultiplier
fields.desc: For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount. Specifies the ratio or multiply factor to convert from contracts to shares (e.g. 1.0, 100, 1000, etc). Applicable For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount.

fields.name: CouponRate
fields.desc: For Fixed Income. For Fixed Income. Coupon rate of the bond. Will be zero for step-up bonds.

fields.name: SecurityExchange
fields.desc: Can be used to identify the security. Market used to help identify a security.

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: EncodedIssuerLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedIssuer field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedIssuer field.

fields.name: EncodedIssuer
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the Issuer field.

fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Security description.

fields.name: EncodedSecurityDesc

fields.name: Side
fields.desc:
Side of Indication
Valid values:
1 = Buy
2 = Sell
7 = Undisclosed (for IOIs) Side of order

values.desc: Undisclosed (valid for IOI and List Order messages only)
Cross (orders where counterparty is an exchange, valid for all messages except IOIs)

fields.name: Currency
fields.desc: Identifies currency used for price. Absence of this field is interpreted as the default for the security. It is recommended that systems provide the currency value whenever possible. See Appendix A: Valid Currency Codes for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: ValidUntilTime

fields.name: IOINaturalFlag
fields.desc: Indicates that IOI is the result of an existing agency order or a facilitation position resulting from an agency order, not from principal trading or order solicitation activity.

fields.name: NoIOIQualifiers
fields.desc: Required if any IOIQualifiers are specified. Indicates the number of repeating IOIQualifiers. Number of repeating groups of IOIQualifiers.

fields.name: IOIQualifier
fields.desc: Required if NoIOIQualifiers > 0 Code to qualify IOI use.

values.desc: At the Market (previously called Current Quote)

fields.name: URLLink
fields.desc: A URL (Uniform Resource Locator) link to additional information (i.e. http://www.XYZ.com/research.html) A URL (Uniform Resource Locator) link to additional information (i.e. http://www.XYZ.com/research.html)

fields.name: NoRoutingIDs
fields.desc: Required if any RoutingType and RoutingIDs are specified. Indicates the number within repeating group. Number of repeating groups of RoutingID (27) and RoutingType (26) values.

fields.name: RoutingType
fields.desc: Indicates type of RoutingID. Required if NoRoutingIDs is > 0. Indicates the type of RoutingID specified.

fields.name: RoutingID
fields.desc: Identifies routing destination. Required if NoRoutingIDs is > 0. Assigned value used to identify a specific routing destination.

fields.name: SpreadToBenchmark
fields.desc: For Fixed Income For Fixed Income. Basis points relative to a benchmark. To be expressed as "count of basis points" (vs. an absolute value). E.g. High Grade Corporate Bonds may express price as basis points relative to benchmark (the Benchmark field). Note: Basis points can be negative.

fields.name: Benchmark
fields.desc: For Fixed Income For Fixed Income. Identifies the benchmark (e.g. used in conjunction with the SpreadToBenchmark field).

messages.name: Order List
messages.intro: The Login Response message is sent by Aquis to acknowledge a Login request, and either accept or reject it.Note that if the senderId field is not recognised as a valid id for a session assigned to a known trading Member then Aquis will drop the connection without sending any response.If the Login request is re-establishing the connection after a break, there may be messages that the trading Member has missed (cancellation of any open orders or potentially any trade reports that were in process at the time of the disconnect).Aquis will compare its current business message sequence number with the atpSeqNo provided on the Login request to detect any gap. The Login Response to the trading Member will carry the current (next expected) Aquis sequence number in its header, which will also notify the trading Member of any gap. Aquis will then resend the missed messages to the trading Member.

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Must be unique, by customer, for the day Unique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: BidID
fields.desc: Should refer to an earlier program if bidding took place. Unique identifier for Bid Response as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day.

fields.name: ClientBidID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for a Bid Request as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day.

fields.name: ProgRptReqs
fields.desc: Code to identify the desired frequency of progress reports.

values.desc: BuySide explicitly requests status using StatusRequest (Default) The sell-side firm can however, send a DONE status List Status Response in an unsolicited fashion
SellSide periodically sends status using ListStatus. Period optionally specified in ProgressPeriod

fields.name: BidType
fields.desc: e.g. Non Disclosed Model, Disclosed Model, No Bidding Process Code to identify the type of Bid Request.

fields.name: ProgPeriodInterval
fields.desc: Time in minutes between each ListStatus report sent by SellSide. Zero means don’t send status.

fields.name: ListExecInstType
fields.desc: Controls when execution should be begin. Identifies the type of ListExecInst.

values.desc: Wait for Execute Instruction (e.g. a List Execute message or phone call before proceeding with execution of the list)

fields.name: ListExecInst
fields.desc: Free-form text. Free format text message containing list handling and execution instructions.

fields.name: EncodedListExecInstLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedListExecInst field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedListExecInst field.

fields.name: EncodedListExecInst
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the ListExecInst field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the ListExecInst field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the ListExecInst field.

fields.name: TotNoOrders
fields.desc: Used to support fragmentation. Sum of NoOrders across all messages with the same ListID. Total number of list order entries across all messages. Should be the sum of all NoOrders in each message that has repeating list order entries related to the same ListID. Used to support fragmentation.

fields.name: NoOrders
fields.desc: Number of orders in this message (number of repeating groups to follow) Indicates number of orders to be combined for average pricing and allocation.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Must be the first field in the repeating group. Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution (identified by SenderCompID or OnBehalfOfCompID as appropriate). Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms, particularly those which electronically submit multi-day orders, trade globally or throughout market close periods,should ensure uniqueness across days, for example by embedding a date within the ClOrdID field.

fields.name: ListSeqNo
fields.desc: Order number within the list Sequence of individual order within list (i.e. ListSeqNo of ListNoOrds, 2 of 25, 3 of 25, . . . )

fields.name: SettlInstMode
fields.desc: Indicates mode used for Settlement Instructions

fields.name: ClientID
fields.desc: Firm identifier used in third party-transactions (should not be a substitute for OnBehalfOfCompID/DeliverToCompID).

fields.name: ExecBroker
fields.desc: Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.name: Account
fields.desc: Account mnemonic as agreed between broker and institution.

fields.name: NoAllocs
fields.desc: Indicates number of pre-trade allocation accounts to follow Number of repeating AllocAccount/AllocPrice entries.

fields.name: AllocAccount
fields.desc: Required if NoAllocs > 0. Must be the first field in the repeating group. Sub-account mnemonic

fields.name: AllocShares
fields.desc: Number of shares to be allocated to specific sub-account

fields.name: SettlmntTyp
fields.desc: Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fields.name: FutSettDate
fields.desc: Specific date of trade settlement (SettlementDate) in YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fields.name: HandlInst
fields.desc: Instructions for order handling on Broker trading floor

values.desc: Automated execution order, private, no Broker intervention
Automated execution order, public, Broker intervention OK

fields.name: ExecInst
fields.desc: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited. If OrdType=P, exactly one of the following values (ExecInst = L, R, M, P, O, T, or W) must be specified. Instructions for order handling on exchange trading floor. If more than one instruction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions separated by space.

values.desc: Percent of volume (indicates that the sender does not want to be all of the volume on the floor vs. a specific percentage)
Primary peg (primary market - buy at bid/sell at offer)
Fixed Peg to Local best bid or offer at time of order

fields.name: MinQty
fields.desc: Minimum quantity of an order to be executed.

fields.name: MaxFloor
fields.desc: Maximum number of shares within an order to be shown on the exchange floor at any given time.

fields.name: ExDestination
fields.desc: Execution destination as defined by institution when order is entered.

fields.name: NoTradingSessions
fields.desc: Number of TradingSessionIDs in repeating group.

fields.name: TradingSessionID
fields.desc: First field in repeating group. Required if NoTradingSessions > 0. Identifier for Trading Session. Can be used to represent a specific market trading session (e.g. "PRE-OPEN", "CROSS_2", "AFTER-HOURS", "TOSTNET1", "TOSTNET2", etc).Values should be bi-laterally agreed to between counterparties. Firms may register Trading Session values on the FIX website (presently a document maintained within "ECN and Exchanges" working group section).

fields.name: ProcessCode
fields.desc: Processing code for sub-account. Absence of this field in AllocAccount / AllocPrice/AllocShares / ProcessCode instance indicates regular trade.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Note also see SecurityType. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Identifies class of alternative SecurityID

values.desc: Consolidated Tape Association (CTA) Symbol (SIAC CTS/CQS line format)

fields.name: SecurityType
fields.desc: Must be specified if a Future or Option. If a Future: Symbol, SecurityType, and MaturityMonthYear are required. If an Option: Symbol, SecurityType, MaturityMonthYear, PutOrCall, and StrikePrice are required. Indicates type of security (ISITC spec)

values.desc: Wildcard entry (used on Security Definition Request message)
Convertible Bond (Note not part of ISITC spec)
Cats, Tigers & Lions (a real code: US Treasury Receipts)

fields.name: MaturityMonthYear
fields.desc: Specifiesthe month and year of maturity. Required if MaturityDay is specified. Month and Year of the maturity for SecurityType=FUT or SecurityType=OPT. Required if MaturityDay is specified. Format: YYYYMM (eg. 199903)

fields.name: MaturityDay
fields.desc: Can be used in conjunction with MaturityMonthYear to specify a particular maturity date. Day of month used in conjunction with MaturityMonthYear to specify the maturity date for SecurityType=FUT or SecurityType=OPT.

fields.name: PutOrCall
fields.desc: For Options. Indicates whether an Option is for a put or call.

fields.name: StrikePrice
fields.desc: For Options. Strike Price for an Option.

fields.name: OptAttribute
fields.desc: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants to indicate a versioning of the contract when required due to corporate actions to the underlying. Should not be used to indicate type of option - use the CFICode[461] for this purpose. Can be used for SecurityType (67) =OPT to identify a particular security. Valid values vary by SecurityExchange:For Exchange: MONEP (Paris)L = Long (a.k.a. "American")S = Short (a.k.a. "European")For Exchanges: DTB (Frankfurt), HKSE (Hong Kong), and SOFFEX (Zurich)0-9 = single digit "version" number assigned by exchange following capital adjustments (0=current, =prior, 2=prior to , etc).

fields.name: ContractMultiplier
fields.desc: For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount. Specifies the ratio or multiply factor to convert from contracts to shares (e.g. 1.0, 100, 1000, etc). Applicable For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount.

fields.name: CouponRate
fields.desc: For Fixed Income. For Fixed Income. Coupon rate of the bond. Will be zero for step-up bonds.

fields.name: SecurityExchange
fields.desc: Can be used to identify the security. Market used to help identify a security.

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: EncodedIssuerLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedIssuer field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedIssuer field.

fields.name: EncodedIssuer
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Security description.

fields.name: EncodedSecurityDescLen

fields.name: EncodedSecurityDesc
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the SecurityDesc field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the SecurityDesc field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. fields.name: PrevClosePx
fields.desc: Useful for verifying security identification Previous closing price of security.

fields.name: Side
fields.desc: Note: to indicate the side of SideValue1 or SideValue2, specify Side=Undisclosed and SideValueInd=either the SideValue1 or SideValue2 indicator. Side of order

values.desc: Undisclosed (valid for IOI and List Order messages only)
Cross (orders where counterparty is an exchange, valid for all messages except IOIs)

fields.name: SideValueInd
fields.desc: Refers to the SideValue1 or SideValue2. These are used as opposed to Buy or Sell so that the basket can be quoted either way as Buy or Sell. Code to identify which "SideValue" the value refers to. SideValue1 and SideValue2 are used as opposed to Buy or Sell so that the basket can be quoted either way as Buy or Sell.

fields.name: LocateReqd
fields.desc: Indicates whether the broker is to locate the stock in conjunction with a short sell order.

values.desc: Indicates the broker is not required to locate
Indicates the broker is responsible for locating the stock

fields.name: TransactTime
fields.desc: Time of execution/order creation (expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: OrderQty
fields.desc: Either CashOrderQty or OrderQty is required. Note that either, but not both, CashOrderQty or OrderQty should be specified. Number of shares ordered. This represents the number of shares for equities or based on normal convention the number of contracts for options, futures, convertible bonds, etc.

fields.name: CashOrderQty
fields.desc: Either CashOrderQty or OrderQty is required. Note that either, but not both, CashOrderQty or OrderQty should be specified. Specifies the approximate "monetary quantity" for the order. Broker is responsible for converting and calculating OrderQty in shares for subsequent messages. Specifies the approximate order quantity desired in total monetary units vs. as a number of shares. The broker would be responsible for converting and calculating a share quantity (OrderQty) based upon this amount to be used for the actual order and subsequent messages.

fields.name: OrdType
fields.desc: Order type.

values.desc: Funari (Limit Day Order with unexecuted portion handled as Market On Close. e.g. Japan)

fields.name: Price
fields.desc: Price per share

fields.name: StopPx
fields.desc: Price per share

fields.name: Currency
fields.desc: Identifies currency used for price. Absence of this field is interpreted as the default for the security. It is recommended that systems provide the currency value whenever possible. See Appendix A: Valid Currency Codes for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: ComplianceID
fields.desc: ID used to represent this transaction for compliance purposes (e.g. OATS reporting).

fields.name: SolicitedFlag
fields.desc: Indicates whether or not the order was solicited.

fields.name: IOIid
fields.desc: Required for Previously Indicated Orders (OrdType=E) Unique identifier of IOI message.

fields.name: QuoteID
fields.desc: Required for Previously Quoted Orders (OrdType=D) Unique identifier for quote

fields.name: TimeInForce
fields.desc: Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Absence of this field is interpreted as DAY.

fields.name: EffectiveTime
fields.desc: Time the details within the message should take effect (always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: ExpireDate
fields.desc: Conditionally required if TimeInForce = GTD and ExpireTime is not specified. Date of order expiration (last day the order can trade), always expressed in terms of the local market date. The time at which the order expires is determined by the local market’s business practices

fields.name: ExpireTime
fields.desc: Conditionally required if TimeInForce = GTD and ExpireDate is not specified. Time/Date of order expiration (always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: GTBookingInst
fields.desc: States whether executions are booked out or accumulated on a partially filled GT order Code to identify whether to book out executions on a part-filled GT order on the day of execution or to accumulate.

values.desc: book out all trades on day of execution
accumulate executions until order is filled or expires

fields.name: Commission
fields.desc: Commission. Note if CommType is percentage, Commission of 5% should be represented as .05.

fields.name: CommType
fields.desc: Commission type

fields.name: Rule80A
fields.desc: Note that the name of this field is changing to "OrderCapacity" as Rule80A is a very US market-specific term. Other world markets need to convey similar information, however, often a subset of the US values. . See the "Rule80A (aka OrderCapacity) Usage by Market" appendix for market-specific usage of this field.

fields.name: OrderQty2
fields.desc: Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the order quantity for the future portion of a F/X swap. OrderQty of the future part of a F/X swap order.

fields.name: OpenClose
fields.desc: Indicates whether the resulting position after a trade should be an opening position or closing position. Used for omnibus accounting - where accounts are held on a gross basis instead of being netted together.

fields.name: CoveredOrUncovered

fields.name: CustomerOrFirm
fields.desc: Used for options when delivering the order to an execution system/exchange to specify if the order is for a customer or the firm placing the order itself.

fields.name: MaxShow
fields.desc: Maximum number of shares within an order to be shown to other customers (i.e. sent via an IOI).

fields.name: PegDifference
fields.desc: Amount (signed) added to the price of the peg for a pegged order.

fields.name: DiscretionInst
fields.desc: Code to identify the price a DiscretionOffset is related to and should be mathematically added to. Required if DiscretionOffset is specified. Code to identify the price a DiscretionOffset is related to and should be mathematically added to.

fields.name: DiscretionOffset
fields.desc: Amount (signed) added to the "related to" price specified via DiscretionInst. Amount (signed) added to the "related to" price specified via DiscretionInst.

fields.name: ClearingFirm
fields.desc: Firm that will clear the trade. Used if different from the executing firm.

fields.name: ClearingAccount
fields.desc: Supplemental accounting information forwared to clearing house/firm.

messages.name: Security Status Request
messages.intro: A Heartbeat message is simply a message header with a heartbeat id as the message content. For a heartbeat, msgType is set to 0 and msgSeqNo is set to the sequence number that will be set on the next business message.For example, pre-market, before any orders have been sent each Heartbeat message will carry msgSeqNo = 1. The value does not increment because the heartbeat is an unsequenced, session level message.Aquis will respond to a Heartbeat message with an outbound Heartbeat message to confirm receipt and the reliability of the connection.

messages.name: Order Status Request
messages.intro: Aquis sends an Add Order Response message to acknowledge the receipt of an Order Add message. The message is used to notify the trading Member whether or not their order was accepted and, if so, whether it executed (partially or fully) and whether any residual quantity has been added to the book or has been cancelled. If the order traded, this message will be followed by the related Trade message(s).

fields.name: OrderID

fields.name: ClOrdID

Firms, particularly those which electronically submit multi-day orders, trade globally or throughout market close periods,should ensure uniqueness across days, for example by embedding a date within the ClOrdID field.

messages.name: Market Data Request
messages.intro: Some systems allow the transmission of real-time quote, order, trade and/or other price information on a subscription basis.

fields.name: MDReqID
fields.desc: Must be unique, or the ID of previous Market Data Request to disable if SubscriptionRequestType = Disable previous Snapshot + Updates Request (2). Unique identifier for Market Data Request

fields.name: SubscriptionRequestType
fields.desc: SubcriptionRequestType indicates to the other party what type of response is expected. A snapshot request only asks for current information. A subscribe request asks for updates as the status changes. Unsubscribe will cancel any future update messages from the counter party. Subscription Request Type

fields.name: MarketDepth
fields.desc: Depth of market for Book Snapshot

fields.name: MDUpdateType
fields.desc: Required if SubscriptionRequestType = Snapshot + Updates (1). Specifies the type of Market Data update.

fields.name: AggregatedBook
fields.desc: Specifies whether or not book entries should be aggregated.

values.desc: Multiple entries per side per price allowed
one book entry per side per price

fields.name: NoMDEntryTypes
fields.desc: Number of MDEntryType fields requested. Number of MDEntryType fields requested.

fields.name: MDEntryType
fields.desc: Must be the first field in this repeating group. This is a list of all the types of Market Data Entries that the firm requesting the Market Data is interested in receiving. Type Market Data entry.

fields.name: NoRelatedSym
fields.desc: Number of symbols requested. Specifies the number of repeating symbols specified.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Must be the first field in the repeating group. Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Note also see SecurityType. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Identifies class of alternative SecurityID

values.desc: Consolidated Tape Association (CTA) Symbol (SIAC CTS/CQS line format)

fields.name: SecurityType
fields.desc: Must be specified if a Future or Option. If a Future:Symbol, SecurityType, and MaturityMonthYear are required. If an Option:Symbol, SecurityType, MaturityMonthYear, PutOrCall, and StrikePrice are required. Indicates type of security (ISITC spec)

values.desc: Wildcard entry (used on Security Definition Request message)
Convertible Bond (Note not part of ISITC spec)
Cats, Tigers & Lions (a real code: US Treasury Receipts)

fields.name: MaturityMonthYear
fields.desc: Specifiesthe month and year of maturity. Required if MaturityDay is specified. Month and Year of the maturity for SecurityType=FUT or SecurityType=OPT. Required if MaturityDay is specified. Format: YYYYMM (eg. 199903)

fields.name: MaturityDay
fields.desc: Can be used in conjunction with MaturityMonthYear to specify a particular maturity date. Day of month used in conjunction with MaturityMonthYear to specify the maturity date for SecurityType=FUT or SecurityType=OPT.

fields.name: PutOrCall
fields.desc: For Options. Indicates whether an Option is for a put or call.

fields.name: StrikePrice
fields.desc: For Options. Strike Price for an Option.

fields.name: OptAttribute
fields.desc: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants to indicate a versioning of the contract when required due to corporate actions to the underlying. Should not be used to indicate type of option - use the CFICode[461] for this purpose. Can be used for SecurityType (67) =OPT to identify a particular security. Valid values vary by SecurityExchange:For Exchange: MONEP (Paris)L = Long (a.k.a. "American")S = Short (a.k.a. "European")For Exchanges: DTB (Frankfurt), HKSE (Hong Kong), and SOFFEX (Zurich)0-9 = single digit "version" number assigned by exchange following capital adjustments (0=current, =prior, 2=prior to , etc).

fields.name: ContractMultiplier
fields.desc: For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount. Specifies the ratio or multiply factor to convert from contracts to shares (e.g. 1.0, 100, 1000, etc). Applicable For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount.

fields.name: CouponRate
fields.desc: For Fixed Income. For Fixed Income. Coupon rate of the bond. Will be zero for step-up bonds.

fields.name: SecurityExchange
fields.desc: Can be used to identify the security. Market used to help identify a security.

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: EncodedIssuerLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedIssuer field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedIssuer field.

fields.name: EncodedIssuer
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the Issuer field.

fields.name: SecurityDesc

fields.name: LastCapacity
fields.desc: Broker capacity in order execution

fields.name: LeavesQty
fields.desc: Amount of shares open for further execution. If the OrdStatus is Canceled, DoneForTheDay, Expired, Calculated, or Rejected (in which case the order is no longer active) then LeavesQty could be 0, otherwise LeavesQty = OrderQty - CumQty. Amount of shares open for further execution. If the OrdStatus is Canceled, DoneForTheDay, Expired, Calculated, or Rejected (in which case the order is no longer active) then LeavesQty could be 0, otherwise LeavesQty = OrderQty – CumQty.

fields.name: CumQty
fields.desc: Currently executed shares for chain of orders. Total number of shares filled.

fields.name: AvgPx
fields.desc: Calculated average price of all fills on this order.

fields.name: DayOrderQty
fields.desc: For GT orders on days following the day of the first trade. For GT orders, the OrderQty less all shares (adjusted for stock splits) that traded on previous days. DayOrderQty = OrderQty – (CumQty - DayCumQty)

fields.name: DayCumQty
fields.desc: For GT orders on days following the day of the first trade. The number of shares on a GT order that have traded today.

fields.name: DayAvgPx
fields.desc: For GT orders on days following the day of the first trade. The average price of shares on a GT order that have traded today.

fields.name: GTBookingInst
fields.desc: States whether executions are booked out or accumulated on a partially filled GT order Code to identify whether to book out executions on a part-filled GT order on the day of execution or to accumulate.

values.desc: book out all trades on day of execution
accumulate executions until order is filled or expires

fields.name: TradeDate
fields.desc: Used when reporting other than current day trades. Indicates date of trade referenced in this message in YYYYMMDD format. Absence of this field indicates current day (expressed in local time at place of trade).

fields.name: TransactTime
fields.desc: Time the transaction represented by this ExecutionReport occurred Time of execution/order creation (expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: ReportToExch
fields.desc: Identifies party of trade responsible for exchange reporting.

values.desc: Indicates that party sending message will report trade
Indicates that party receiving message must report trade

fields.name: Commission
fields.desc: On a fill/partial fill messages, it represents value for that fill/partial fill, on ExecType=Calculated, it represents cumulative value for the order. Monetary commission values are expressed in the currency reflected by the Currency field. Commission. Note if CommType is percentage, Commission of 5% should be represented as .05.

fields.name: CommType
fields.desc: Commission type

fields.name: GrossTradeAmt
fields.desc: Total amount traded (e.g. CumQty * AvgPx) expressed in units of currency.

fields.name: SettlCurrAmt
fields.desc: Used to report results of forex accommodation trade Total amount due expressed in settlement currency (includes the effect of the forex transaction)

fields.name: SettlCurrency
fields.desc: Used to report results of forex accommodation trade Currency code of settlement denomination.

fields.name: SettlCurrFxRate
fields.desc: Foreign exchange rate used to compute SettlCurrAmt from Currency to SettlCurrency Foreign exchange rate used to compute SettlCurrAmt from Currency to SettlCurrency

fields.name: SettlCurrFxRateCalc
fields.desc: Specifies whether the SettlCurrFxRate should be multiplied or divided Specifies whether or not SettlCurrFxRate should be multiplied or divided.

fields.name: HandlInst
fields.desc: Instructions for order handling on Broker trading floor

values.desc: Automated execution order, private, no Broker intervention
Automated execution order, public, Broker intervention OK

fields.name: MinQty
fields.desc: Minimum quantity of an order to be executed.

fields.name: MaxFloor
fields.desc: Maximum number of shares within an order to be shown on the exchange floor at any given time.

fields.name: OpenClose
fields.desc: For options Indicates whether the resulting position after a trade should be an opening position or closing position. Used for omnibus accounting - where accounts are held on a gross basis instead of being netted together.

fields.name: MaxShow
fields.desc: Maximum number of shares within an order to be shown to other customers (i.e. sent via an IOI).

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string. Note: this field does not have a specified maximum length

fields.name: EncodedTextLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedText field.

fields.name: EncodedText
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the Text field.

fields.name: OrderQty2
fields.desc: Can be used with OrdType = "Forex - Swap" to specify the order quantity for the future portion of a F/X swap. OrderQty of the future part of a F/X swap order.

fields.name: ClearingFirm

fields.name: ClearingAccount

values.desc: Individual leg of a multi-leg security

messages.name: Bid Response
messages.intro: The Bid Response message can be used in one of two ways depending on which market conventions are being followed.In the "Non disclosed" convention the Bid Response message can be used to supply a bid based on the sector, country, index and liquidity information contained within the corresponding bid request message. See "Program/Basket/List Trading" for an example.In the "Disclosed" convention the Bid Response message can be used to supply bids based on the List Order Detail messages sent in advance of the corresponding Bid Request message.

fields.name: BidID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Bid Response as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day.

fields.name: ClientBidID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for a Bid Request as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day.

fields.name: NoBidComponents
fields.desc: Number of bid repeating groups Indicates the number of list entries.

fields.name: Commission
fields.desc: First element of price. Required if NoBidComponents > 0. Commission. Note if CommType is percentage, Commission of 5% should be represented as .05.

fields.name: CommType
fields.desc: Commission type

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: Country
fields.desc: ISO Country Code ISO Country Code in field

fields.name: Side
fields.desc: When used in response to a "Disclosed" request indicates whether SideValue1 is Buy or Sell. SideValue2 can be derived by inference. Side of order

values.desc: Undisclosed (valid for IOI and List Order messages only)
Cross (orders where counterparty is an exchange, valid for all messages except IOIs)

fields.name: Price
fields.desc: Second element of price Price per share

fields.name: PriceType
fields.desc: Code to represent the price type.

fields.name: FairValue
fields.desc: The difference between the value of a future and the value of the underlying equities after allowing for the discounted cash flows associated with the underlying stocks (E.g. Dividends etc). Used in EFP trades

fields.name: NetGrossInd
fields.desc: Net/Gross Code to represent whether value is net (inclusive of tax) or gross.

fields.name: SettlmntTyp
fields.desc: Indicates order settlement period for Detail. Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fields.name: FutSettDate
fields.desc: Specific date of trade settlement (SettlementDate) in YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fields.name: TradingSessionID
fields.desc: Identifier for Trading Session. Can be used to represent a specific market trading session (e.g. "PRE-OPEN", "CROSS_2", "AFTER-HOURS", "TOSTNET1", "TOSTNET2", etc).Values should be bi-laterally agreed to between counterparties. Firms may register Trading Session values on the FIX website (presently a document maintained within "ECN and Exchanges" working group section).

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string. Note: this field does not have a specified maximum length

fields.name: EncodedTextLen
fields.desc: Must be set if EncodedText field is specified and must immediately precede it. Byte length of encoded (non-ASCII characters) EncodedText field.

fields.name: EncodedText
fields.desc: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Text field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the Text field.

messages.name: Standard Header
messages.intro: The standard FIX message header

fields.name: BeginString
fields.desc: Always unencrypted, must be first field in message. Identifies beginning of new message and protocol version.

fields.name: BodyLength
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted, must be second field in message) Message length, in bytes, forward to the CheckSum field. ALWAYS SECOND FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted)

fields.name: MsgType
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted, must be third field in message) Defines message type. ALWAYS THIRD FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted). Note: A "U" as the first character in the MsgType field (i.e. U1, U2, etc) indicates that the message format is privately defined between the sender and receiver.

fields.name: SenderCompID
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted) Assigned value used to identify firm sending message.

fields.name: TargetCompID
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted) Assigned value used to identify receiving firm.

fields.name: OnBehalfOfCompID
fields.desc: Trading partner company ID used when sending messages via a third party (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify firm originating message if the message was delivered by a third party i.e. the third party firm identifier would be delivered in the SenderCompID field and the firm originating the message in this field.

fields.name: DeliverToCompID
fields.desc: Trading partner company ID used when sending messages via a third party (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify the firm targeted to receive the message if the message is delivered by a third party i.e. the third party firm identifier would be delivered in the TargetCompID field and the ultimate receiver firm ID in this field.

fields.name: SecureDataLen
fields.desc: Required to identify length of encrypted section of message. (Always unencrypted) Length of encrypted message

fields.name: SecureData
fields.desc: Required when message body is encrypted. Always immediately follows SecureDataLen field. Actual encrypted data stream

fields.name: MsgSeqNum
fields.desc: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Integer message sequence number.

fields.name: SenderSubID
fields.desc: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Optional, may be used to provide the identity of the trader who entered the order.

fields.name: SenderLocationID
fields.desc: Sender's LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message originator’s location (i.e. geographic location and/or desk, trader)

fields.name: TargetSubID
fields.desc: "ADMIN" reserved for administrative messages not intended for a specific user. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific individual or unit intended to receive message. "ADMIN" reserved for administrative messages not intended for a specific user.

fields.name: TargetLocationID
fields.desc: Trading partner LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message destination’s location (i.e. geographic location and/or desk, trader)

fields.name: OnBehalfOfSubID
fields.desc: Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message originator (i.e. trader) if the message was delivered by a third party

fields.name: OnBehalfOfLocationID
fields.desc: Trading partner LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message originator’s location (i.e. geographic location and/or desk, trader) if the message was delivered by a third party

fields.name: DeliverToSubID
fields.desc: Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message recipient (i.e. trader) if the message is delivered by a third party

fields.name: DeliverToLocationID
fields.desc: Trading partner LocationID (i.e. geographic location and/or desk) used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message recipient’s location (i.e. geographic location and/or desk, trader) if the message was delivered by a third party

fields.name: PossDupFlag
fields.desc: Always required for retransmitted messages, whether prompted by the sending system or as the result of a resend request. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Indicates possible retransmission of message with this sequence number

fields.name: PossResend
fields.desc: Required when message may be duplicate of another message sent under a different sequence number. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Indicates that message may contain information that has been sent under another sequence number.

fields.name: SendingTime
fields.desc: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Time of message transmission (always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: OrigSendingTime
fields.desc: Can be embedded within encrypted data section. Original time of message transmission (always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT") when transmitting orders as the result of a resend request.

fields.name: XmlDataLen
fields.desc: Required when specifying XmlData to identify the length of a XmlData message block. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Length of the XmlData data block.

fields.name: XmlData
fields.desc:
Can contain a XML formatted message block (e.g. FIXML). Always immediately follows XmlDataLen field. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
See Appendix M – FIXML Support Actual XML data stream (e.g. FIXML). See approriate XML reference (e.g. FIXML). Note: may contain embedded SOH characters.

fields.name: MessageEncoding
fields.desc: Type of message encoding (non-ASCII characters) used in a message’s "Encoded" fields. Required if any "Encoding" fields are used. Type of message encoding (non-ASCII (non-English) characters) used in a message’s "Encoded" fields.

fields.name: LastMsgSeqNumProcessed
fields.desc: The last MsgSeqNum value received and processed. Can be specified on every message sent. Useful for detecting a backlog with a counterparty. The last MsgSeqNum value received and processed. Can be specified on every message sent. Useful for detecting a backlog with a counterparty.

fields.name: OnBehalfOfSendingTime
fields.desc: Used when a message is sent via a "hub" or "service bureau". If A sends to Q (the hub) who then sends to B via a separate FIX session, then when Q sends to B the value of this field should represent the SendingTime on the message A sent to Q. (always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT") Used when a message is sent via a "hub" or "service bureau". If A sends to Q (the hub) who then sends to B via a separate FIX session, then when Q sends to B the value of this field should represent the SendingTime on the message A sent to Q. (always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

messages.name: Standard Trailer
messages.intro: The standard FIX message trailer

fields.name: SignatureLength
fields.desc: Required when trailer contains signature. Note: Not to be included within SecureData field Number of bytes in signature field.

fields.name: Signature
fields.desc: Note: Not to be included within SecureData field Electronic signature

fields.name: CheckSum
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted, always last field in message) Three byte, simple checksum (see Appendix B: CheckSum Calculation for description). ALWAYS LAST FIELD IN MESSAGE; i.e. serves, with the trailing , as the end-of-message delimiter. Always defined as three characters. (Always unencrypted)
